page.title: 10THE RIVER THAMES AT LALEHAM
page.content: The{River Thames at Laleham}meanders across a wide flood plain.Upstream it is flanked by private moorings and adjoining riverside houses.Downstream is more rural with park and farmland and a campsite.Since the Laleham ferry no longer functions the{Thames can only be crossed at Staines or Chertsey bridges.Houseboat owners on the south bank row themselves across. There are a small boat builders and 2 yacht clubs.In summer the river is busy with hired cruisers,sailing boats,canoes and racing skiffs. It is a popular area for fishermen and these sadly have caused a rapid decline in the swan population,due to lead poisoning.96 lead shot were picked up in 30 minutes on part of Laleham Reach in May.Fortunately the Save Our Swans society has been able to aid some swans.
